**Wikipedia summary**:  
<i><b>Pteridium aquilinum</b></i>, commonly called <b>bracken</b>, <b>brake</b>, <b>common bracken</b>, and also known as <b>eagle fern</b>, is a species of fern occurring in temperate and subtropical regions in both hemispheres. Originally native to Eurasia and North America, the extreme lightness of its spores has led to it achieving a cosmopolitan distribution.
